title: Acceptance
description: A collection that reflects the artist’s journey of embracing selfhood, memory, and myth. Each painting is a mirror of inner landscapes where mythological roots and personal places converge into a quiet act of acceptance.

paintings.name: Yggdrasil
paintings.materials: Gouache, gold leaf, handmade wasli paper
paintings.process: Layered washes, micro detailing, dry-brush textures
paintings.description: Named after the sacred tree of Norse mythology, Yggdrasil symbolizes interconnectedness  roots reaching into the underworld, branches stretching into the heavens. This painting becomes a metaphor for the artist’s own life: rooted in memory, yet constantly reaching toward transcendence.

paintings.name: A Place I Know
paintings.process: Wet-on-dry, dot detailing, layered petal strokes
paintings.description: This work evokes a familiar landscape  not just physical, but emotional. It is a sanctuary of rediscovery, where fragments of identity gather like petals in bloom. The title suggests intimacy: a place within the self that is both remembered and reimagined.
